page.title: 04A FARMER'S DAY NEAR BUDE
page.content: Mr Dingle gets up at 5:30 and gets the cows in from the field to milk them.He has 102 Friesian cows and after milking they go back into the field.He then cleans the milking equipment and the yards.For breakfast he has bacon and eggs with coffee.The rest of the morning is spent on routine jobs such as injecting calves,dealing with sick cows,or office work.In summer he is busy cutting hay or silage. After dinner at 1:00 he may go to various societies such as the{National {Farmers Union,}or{Royal Society for {Preservation of Birds.}At 4:00 the cows are milked again.In winter most of the day is spent feeding and bedding the cows which are housed in the barn.During the evening he may attend a meeting of the{Parents {Association}at Budehaven School.
